ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, did the health worker ask about your thoughts, feelings, or concerns in your heart/mind?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker ask you about what you think caused your health problem?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker ask you questions that made you feel uncomfortable or embarrassed?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker explain about your health problem (for example: cause, symptoms)?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker speak in a way that was easy to understand and explain things clearly?
In the past 3 months, did you feel that the health worker understood your problems and what you hoped to improve from treatment?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker involve your family members in the course of your treatment?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 666= Participant cannot remember; 777= Not applicable as patient or family member not present

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, did the health worker discuss how long it would take for your health problem to get better?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker ask you about thoughts of dying, thoughts of hurting yourself, or suicidal thoughts?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker ask you about drinking alcohol or beer?
In the past 3 months, did the health worker show any unhelpful behavior towards you?
